Hey all,

This issue has been resolved (some of Oliver's CMAKE variables we=
re 
set wrong) but has uncovered another issue: The MPI HyperNEAT 
extensio=
n has a couple of errors in it.  The next version of 
HyperNEAT will have a=
 fix to address the MPI build.  In the meantime, 
the non-MPI hyperNEAT bui=
ld & the python HyperNEAT module still work 
fine.

--- In neat@yahoogroups=
.com, "Jason Gauci" <jgmath2000@...> wrote:
>
> Hey Oliver.
> 
> I run ubun=
tu myself and it works fine, but I use a custom version of
> wxwidgets.  I'=
m going to look into what might be causing your 
problem
> with the default=
 wxwidgets library.
> 
> In the meantime, you can turn off the GUI by using=
 the "ccmake"
> command and setting the "use gui" flag to off.
> 
> I'll le=
t you know what I find out.
> 
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Oliver Colem=
an" <oliver@> wrote:
> >
> > I seem to have gotten all the dependencies sor=
ted out, all that 
remains

ces between compilers 
(or
> > versions). Which compiler and version was it=
 originally written 
for?

3.3, 3.4, 4.1 and 
4.2, for

> > 
>=
 > HCUBE_EvaluationPanel.h:9: error: expected class-name before `{'

en

=

ry, which 
seems odd
> > given that I installed it from the Ubuntu reposito=
ries):

ot

:47: error: no matching 
function for

Bitmap&, const wxColour&,
> > int&)'
> > 
> > /usr/include/wx-2.8/wx/region=
.h:127: note: candidates are: bool
> > wxRegionBase::Union(wxCoord, wxCoord=
, wxCoord, wxCoord)
> >

 the code (not sure 
what
> > do about wxwidgets though) to compile under G=
++ 4.2 and post it 
back to
> > this group, but would like as much info as =
I can get before 
proceeding
> > with this.
